item.title: A note on computer round-off error in physics
item.description: The way floating-point numbers are stored in the memory of a computer can lead to unwanted errors. Here we have an overview of the basics of storing numbers and how they affect the outcome of physics programs.

item.title: Tutorial: Setup of Entity Framework (EF) core for CRUD and authentication with Razor pages

item.title: How Inversion of Control improves flexibility of numerical codes?
item.description: Introduction When programming it’s very convenient to create class A which has a concrete member class B. However, this creates a tightly-coupled system since any change in B should be reflected in A.
